intro: Jaumea tessmannii, commonly known as the New Zealand flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its triangular, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, such as swampy areas and riverbanks. Jaumea tessmannii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
